item.title: 历史性挤压冲击市场，白银交易商急忙将银条运往伦敦
item.description: 伦敦白银市场因大规模空头挤压而陷入动荡，银价历史上第二次突破每盎司 50 美元，并引发了人们对 1980 年亿万富翁亨特兄弟试图占领市场的恶行的回忆。【原文：The London silver market has been thrown into turmoil by a massive short squeeze, driving prices above $50 an ounce for only the second time in history and stirring memories of the billionaire Hunt brothers’ notorious attempt to corner the market in 1980.】

item.title: 越南大幅经济改革计划令投资者兴奋不已
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）对美国的主要贸易伙伴之一越南征收了最具惩罚性的关税，而就在几个月后，这个东南亚国家的股市飙升，其国内生产总值（GDP）的增长几乎超过了所有预期，甚至还与这位重情重义的美国总统达成了某种协议。【原文：Just months after Donald Trump singled out Vietnam for one of the most punitive tariff rates on a major US trading partner, the Southeast Asian nation’s stock market has soared, its GDP growth is beating almost all estimates and it’s even managed a deal of sorts with the mercurial American president.】

item.title: 蕾切尔-里夫斯希望在英国紧缩预算中提高财政缓冲能力
item.description: 英国财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）希望在即将到来的预算中增加财政缓冲，以降低英国的借贷成本，使政府财政更好地抵御市场波动。【原文：Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves is looking to increase her fiscal buffer at the upcoming budget, as she seeks to bring down the UK’s borrowing costs and better insulate the government’s finances against market volatility.】

item.title: 第三大稳定币在加密货币暴跌中短暂失去美元挂钩
item.description: 加密货币项目 Ethena 的收益稳定币在市场暴跌期间短暂失去了与美元的挂钩，引发了创纪录的清算。【原文：Crypto project Ethena’s yield-bearing stablecoin briefly lost its dollar peg during a market rout that triggered record liquidations.】

item.title: 描绘全球经济：政治大戏笼罩法国
item.description: 本周早些时候，塞巴斯蒂安-勒科努（Sebastien Lecornu）辞去总理职务，法国金融市场已从一场政治风波中基本恢复，周五晚些时候他又被重新任命。【原文：French financial markets had mostly recovered from a political dustup earlier this week when Sebastien Lecornu stepped down as prime minister, before being reappointed late Friday.】

item.title: Messaggero 称 Bending Spoons 希望收购 Typeform 和 Elysium
item.description: 据《Il Messaggero》报道，软件公司的连续买家 Bending Spoons SpA 继最近竞购 Vimeo 和 AOL 之后，正在寻求收购应用程序开发商 Typeform 和 Elysium。【原文：Bending Spoons SpA, a serial buyer of software companies, is pursuing the acquisition of app developers Typeform and Elysium following its recent bids for Vimeo and AOL, according to Il Messaggero.】

item.title: 伦敦市中心的高昂租金开始蔓延
item.description: 除了最富裕的租户，伦敦最令人向往的街区对所有人来说都是遥不可及的，而且这种影响还在向外扩散。【原文：London’s most desirable neighborhoods are out of reach for all but the most affluent tenants, and the effects are rippling out.】

item.title: 为什么黄金的上涨可能才刚刚开始？
item.description: "触摸黄金是你最接近永恒的方式"【原文：“To touch gold is the closest you will ever come to touching eternity.”】

item.title: 德国的 1.3 万亿欧元债务正成为默茨的战场
item.description: 德国在反思如何重振奄奄一息的经济时遇到了一个硬道理：不断扩张的福利国家是问题的一部分。【原文：Germany’s soul-searching over how to revive its moribund economy is running into a hard truth: a sprawling welfare state is part of the problem.】

item.title: 汇丰 140 亿美元交易为香港的繁荣之年增添动力
item.description: 本周四之前，今年对香港的交易商来说已经是丰收的一年。随后，汇丰控股有限公司（HSBC Holdings Plc）以 140 亿美元收购恒生银行有限公司（Hang Seng Bank Ltd.）的提议让事情变得更加扑朔迷离。【原文：This year was already a fertile one for dealmakers in Hong Kong leading into Thursday. Then came HSBC Holdings Plc with its proposed $14 billion buyout of Hang Seng Bank Ltd. to really put a rocket under things.】

item.title: First Brands 难以捉摸的首席执行官考虑下台，风波渐起
item.description: 破产的 First Brands 集团首席执行官帕特里克-詹姆斯（Patrick James）鲜为人知，他正在考虑下台，因为这家汽车零部件供应商的迅速倒闭在华尔街引起了强烈反响。【原文：Patrick James, the little-known chief executive officer of bankrupt First Brands Group, is weighing stepping down as fallout from the auto-parts supplier’s swift collapse reverberates across Wall Street.】

item.title: Target 在明尼苏达州试销 THC 饮料
item.description: 塔吉特公司（Target Corp. ）正在少数几家分店试销大麻提取的 THC 饮料，这标志着一个在很大程度上被全国连锁店拒之门外的行业的一个重要里程碑。【原文：Target Corp. is testing the sale of hemp-derived THC beverages at a handful of locations, marking an important milestone for an industry that’s largely been shut out of national chains.】

item.title: 美国终止对液化天然气船的处罚，并在与中国不断升级的争执中设置关税
item.description: 根据一项旨在遏制中国海洋主导地位的全面政策，特朗普政府取消了原定于下周生效的对美国液化天然气公司的处罚。【原文：The Trump administration scrapped penalties for US liquefied natural gas companies that were set to take effect next week under a sweeping policy aimed at curbing China’s maritime dominance.】

item.title: Bose 因终止旧款扬声器的云流媒体服务而激怒客户
item.description: Bose 公司本周宣布，将于二月停止为其 "SoundTouch "系列音频扬声器提供云基础设施，从而使这些设备无法直接串流 Spotify、Pandora、亚马逊音乐等服务的音乐。【原文：Bose Corp. announced this week that it will discontinue the cloud infrastructure for its “SoundTouch” line of audio speakers in February, rendering the devices unable to directly stream music from services like Spotify, Pandora, Amazon Music and others.】

item.title: 美国杠杆贷款市场面临压力，更多交易被撤销
item.description: 美国杠杆贷款市场正承受着更大的压力，一周内出现了第二笔被撤消的交易，其他交易也做出了一系列有利于投资者的调整，以帮助这些交易顺利完成。【原文：The US leveraged loan market is coming under further pressure with its second pulled deal in a week and a slew of investor-friendly changes made on other transactions to help get them over the line.】

item.title: 加密货币清算额超过 60 亿美元
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普表示将对中国征收 100%的额外关税并对软件实施出口管制后，加密货币暴跌，在过去一小时内有超过 60 亿美元的头寸被清算。【原文：Cryptocurrencies tumbled after US President Donald Trump said he would impose an additional 100% tariff on China and export controls on software, with more than $6 billion in positions liquidated within the past hour.】

item.title: 穆迪因债务风险将塞内加尔信用评级下调至 Caa1
item.description: 穆迪评级公司（Moody's Ratings）在今年第二次下调这个西非国家的信用评级时表示，自上次审查以来，塞内加尔的债务表明该国的财政轨迹和流动性状况面临着越来越大的风险。【原文：Senegal’s debt shows growing risks to the country’s fiscal trajectory and liquidity position since the previous review, Moody’s Ratings said, as it downgraded the West African nation’s credit rating for the second time this year.】

item.title: 巴西金融科技公司 PicPay 据称将在美国 IPO 募集 5 亿美元资金
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，亿万富翁巴蒂斯塔家族投资控股公司旗下的巴西移动银行应用程序 PicPay 正在寻求在美国首次公开募股中筹集多达约 5 亿美元的资金。【原文：PicPay, the Brazilian mobile banking app owned by the billionaire Batista family’s investment holding company, is looking to raise as much as about $500 million in its US initial public offering, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 旅游软件公司纳凡，控股股东在美国首次公开募股中寻求 9.6 亿美元投资
item.description: 尽管美国政府停摆，但商务旅行和费用管理软件制造商 Navan Inc.【原文：Navan Inc., a business travel and expense management software maker, and some of its shareholders are seeking to raise as much as $960 million in an initial public offering, moving forward with a listing despite the US government shutdown.】

item.title: 国家减债后穆迪上调加纳信用评级
item.description: 穆迪评级公司（Moody's Ratings）上调了加纳的主权信用评级，理由是减债前景有所改善。【原文：Moody’s Ratings raised Ghana’s sovereign credit rating, citing improved prospects for debt reduction.】

item.title: 被马杜罗政权污蔑的诺贝尔奖获得者誓言在委内瑞拉继续奋斗
item.description: 尼古拉斯-马杜罗（Nicolás Maduro）总统将反对党领袖玛丽亚-科里纳-马查多（María Corina Machado）称为 "野蛮的女魔头"、"战犯 "和 "la Sayona"（委内瑞拉民间传说中的复仇之灵）。【原文：President Nicolás Maduro has described opposition leader María Corina Machado as a “wild demoness,” a “war criminal,” and “la Sayona,” a vengeful spirit from Venezuelan folklore.】

item.title: 全球芯片供应链正准备应对中国稀土限制带来的影响
item.description: 中国采取了迄今为止最有针对性的措施来限制稀土材料的供应，而稀土材料对于制造推动人工智能蓬勃发展的芯片至关重要。【原文：Businesses across the global semiconductor supply chain are bracing themselves for disruptions from China’s most targeted move yet to limit their supplies of rare-earth materials, which are critical to building the chips fueling the artificial intelligence boom.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利要求从杰富瑞的 Point Bonita 提取现金
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，摩根士丹利的资产管理业务部门要求赎回其在杰富瑞金融集团（Jefferies Financial Group Inc.【原文：Morgan Stanley’s asset-management business asked to redeem some money it invested in a Jefferies Financial Group Inc. fund with large exposure to the trade debt of bankrupt auto-parts supplier First Brands Group, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 高动量市场的泡沫风险正在上升
item.description: 比尔-哈尼奇（Bill Harnisch）不是 "永久熊"。他的对冲基金自 2020 年以来上涨了 580%，这要归功于他精雕细琢的投资组合，仅今年一年，他的对冲基金的回报率就达到了 S&P 500 指数的三倍。【原文：Bill Harnisch is no permabear. His hedge fund is up 580% since 2020 thanks to a honed portfolio of bets that this year alone has tripled the S&P 500’s return.】

item.title: 埃及获得 S&P 公司评级，这是经济好转的最新迹象
item.description: S&P评级公司提高了埃及的信用评级，理由是埃及的政策变化改善了经济前景，这是在获得570亿美元的全球救助后对埃及政府的进一步提振。【原文：S&P Ratings lifted Egypt’s credit rating, citing policy changes that have improved the economic outlook, giving a further boost for authorities after securing a $57 billion global bailout.】

item.title: Lyft 终止向司机显示乘客小费频率的测试
item.description: Lyft 公司结束了一项向部分司机展示乘客小费支付频率的测试，这引起了乘客的强烈不满。【原文：Lyft Inc. has ended a test that showed some drivers how often a passenger tips, following backlash from riders.】

item.title: 特朗普威胁对华加征关税后，VIX 指数飙升，但股市依然秩序井然
item.description: 这是自 4 月份以来美股表现最差的一天，波动率指数大幅走高，但仍远低于过去股市长期抛售时的水平。【原文：The worst day for US stocks since April sent volatility gauges sharply higher, but left them far below levels that have accompanied past bouts of prolonged equity selling.】

item.title: 巴西法官给予 Pimco 支持的 Unigel 破产保护
item.description: 巴西一名法官接受了化肥生产商 Unigel Participacoes 的破产保护请求，该公司两年多来一直在努力重整债务。【原文：A Brazilian judge accepted a bankruptcy protection request from fertilizer maker Unigel Participacoes, which has been struggling for more than two years of trying to re-work its debt.】

item.title: 投资者眼中的秘鲁明星经济未受政治混乱影响
item.description: 投资者打赌，秘鲁绩优的经济将在最近的政治混乱中安然无恙。【原文：Investors are betting that Peru’s top-performing economy will emerge unscathed by the latest bout of political chaos to hit the nation.】

item.title: ETF IQ：杠杆型单一股票基金开始火爆起来
item.description: 欢迎收看 ETF IQ，这是一份专门报道全球 17 万亿美元 ETF 行业的每周通讯。我是彭博新闻社记者兼主播凯蒂-格雷菲尔德（Katie Greifeld）。【原文：Welcome to ETF IQ, a weekly newsletter dedicated to the $17 trillion global ETF industry. I'm Bloomberg News reporter and anchor Katie Greifeld.】
